Title: The Eagle
Country: USA 
USA release: 11/02/2011 
Released in Spain: 08/04/2011 
Released on DVD (rental): 03/08/2011 
Studio: Focus Features 
Director: Kevin MacDonald 
Screenplay: Jeremy Brock 
Starring: Jamie Bell, Channing Tatum, Donald Sutherland, Mark Strong 
Rating: Not recommended for children under 12 years 


Synopsis: 
Britain, second century after Christ. Two men, master and slave, is venturing beyond the frontier of the known world in a search as obsessive as it is dangerous to take them to the limits of loyalty and betrayal, friendship and hate, disappointment and heroism ... 

In 140 AD, the Roman Empire extends to Britain, although its dominance is not complete since the rebel tribes of Caledonia (now Scotland) have become stronger in the north. Marco Aquila (Channing Tatum) arrives in Britain, determined to restore the tarnished reputation of his father, Flavius ??Aquila. Twenty years ago the 5,000 men of the Ninth Legion, led by Flavio and the famous golden emblem, the Eagle of the Ninth Legion marched north to Caledonia. Never again. The Legion and the emblem disappeared into the misty mountains. Furious, the Emperor Hadrian ordered a wall to seal up the territory. Hadrian's Wall became the northernmost frontier of the Roman Empire on the edge of the known world. 

Educated to become a brilliant soldier and the command of a small fort located in the southwest of the island, Marco makes proof of immeasurable value during a siege. Rome praises him, but he separated from service due to serious injuries. Marco, demoralized, convalescing in the village of his uncle Aquila (Donald Sutherland), a retired officer. During a fight of gladiators, Marco impulsively asks to spare the life of a young gladiator, and the Briton purchase Aquila Esca (Jamie Bell) to give away. Marco Esca treated with contempt, and the slave hates everything that is Roman. But Esca swears to serve the man who saved his life. 

On hearing that has been the golden eagle in a temple in the far north, Marco decides to act and, accompanied by Esca, cross Hadrian's Wall. Discover the mountains of Caledonia occupy a vast and wild region. He has no choice but to rely on the slave if you want to reach your destination. They find Guern (Mark Strong), a former Roman legionary, and Marco realizes that the mystery of the disappearance of his father probably has to do with identity and loyalty of his slave. Discover the secret becomes more pressing when both face the fearsome warrior prince of Foca (Tahar Rahim). 

Production notes: 
- A Roman epic adventure based on the classic novel 'The Eagle of the Ninth Legion', set in the dangerous world of second-century Britain.
